content: little chubby bird crochet pattern by thalia evans you ll need pattern uses us terms - 3 5mm crochet hook single_crochet = single_crochet - dk yarn in colour s of your choice half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet - a small amount of scrap yarn in a double_crochet = double_crochet contrasting colour for the beak and feet popcorn = popcorn this pattern uses 5sc popcorn - toy stuffing a good way to use up scraps stitches to make the feet of yarn increase = increase 2 single_crochet in same stitch - needle scissors a few pins stitch decrease = decrease sc2 together markers shift stitch= at the end of the current round move - for the eyes black or contrasting stitch marker forward if right handed or back if left and white embroidery thread or handed one stitch count the stitch after the marker alternatively 4-5mm safety eyes or beads as stitch 1 of the new round approx finished size 3 inches tall the example birds were crocheted right handed if you hold the hook in your left hand you will have to mirror the photos there are three options for completing this project option 1 two piece- option 2 no-sew- body and option 3 seamless- wings and body and wings are crocheted wings are crocheted separately body are made as one seamless separately and sewn together at but the wings are crocheted onto piece minimising the amount of the end easy the body as you work medium ends to weave in hard but looks the best an optional colour chart to make a european robin with 5 colours is included at the end of this pattern i suggest printing it out separately and following the chart as you work note that the colour changes can be challenging contents wings- page 2 body option 1- page 4 body option 2- page 8 body option 3- page 10 beak & eyes- page 12 robin colour chart page 13 1 wings if you are going to use body option 2 make the wings first the wings are a single piece which sits like a cape on the back of the bird and are worked in row you ll make horizontal row first to form the shoulders then vertical row to make feathers of different lengths shoulders 1 chain 15 double_crochet 14 along the chain chain 2 and turn work 2 double_crochet 14 along the row turn the work do not cut yarn or fasten_off feathers you ll work in row using hdcs to create the feather detail when making a stitch into a half_double_crochet always work into the middle loop only this creates a pattern of ridges to define the feathers after completing each feather you ll attach it to the shoulder piece using a slip_stitch note that you will not slip_stitch into every stitch of the shoulders this will help the wings to curve and sit well against the body work into these stitches of the shoulder only when building the feathers feather 1
